message:
Thanks for your comments.  

a) I'll answer this in an upcoming blog post.  
b-c) Yes, I don't bother to implement ODE, instead opting for "undefined behavior". The full rationale behind this is in my [IDisposable CodeProject article](http://www.codeproject.com/KB/dotnet/idisposable.aspx).  

Regarding "managed resources", I consider any IDisposable class to be a managed resource. This includes "resources" such as observer subscriptions or borrowing from a pool. If the resource is considered important enough to warrant implementing IDisposable, then it should be disposed when no longer needed.
